cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast along the South Carolina coast, then turning northeast and accelerating offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina Outer Banks (Cape Lookout–Cape Hatteras area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of Chincoteague, VA to Fenwick Island, DE; Chesapeake Bay Smith Point–Drum Point; Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island; Woods Hole–Sagamore Beach, MA including Nantucket & Martha’s Vineyard
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Savannah River, SC to NC/VA border including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds; Tropical Storm Warning NC/VA border to Chincoteague, VA and lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Savannah River, SC northward through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic coast to Poquoson, VA, with offshore impacts extending toward New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (up to 30–35 kt gusts) with a 27% chance of occurrence Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (generally <2 ft) possible along the Delaware Bay entrance; significant coastal inundation is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could drop 1–3 inches of rain Friday into Saturday, producing brief localized flooding in poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Delaware beaches; sporadic marine/berth disruptions likely.
